entries.title: Many in Canada May Spend Christmas Day Without Power as Storm Continues
entries.description: A gas station is shown without power, following a winter storm in the region, in Montreal on Dec. 24, 2022. (Graham Hughes/The Canadian Press)

entries.title: Chinese Restaurant Announces Closure as South Korea Probes Covert Chinese Police Station
entries.description: A Chinese paramilitary policeman stands guard before security cameras at Tiananmen Square in Beijing on April 8, 2019. (STR/AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: Blaze Kills 22 in Russian Home for Elderly, Electrical Problems Eyed
entries.description: Firefighters battle a blaze at an unregistered home for the elderly in the Siberian city of Kemerovo, Russia, in a still from video released on Dec. 24, 2022. (Russian Emergencies Ministry via Reuters/Screenshot via The Epoch Times)

entries.title: Truck With Liquified Gas Explodes in South Africa; 8 Killed
entries.description: A burned out vehicle marks the spot where a gas tanker exploded under a bridge in Boksburg, east of Johannesburg on Dec. 24, 2022. (Hein Kaiser/AP Photo)

entries.title: VIA Rail Passengers Stranded for Over 18 Hours as Winter Storms Halt Travel Plans Across Canada
entries.description: A person walks through blowing snow during a snowstorm in Toronto on Dec. 23, 2022. (Arlyn McAdorey/The Canadian Press)

entries.title: UK’s Sunak Sends Christmas Thanks to Public Servants as Strikes Continue
entries.description: Britain's Prime Minister Rishi Sunak leaves 10 Downing Street to attend the Prime Minister's Questions (PMQ) session at the House of Commons, in London, on Dec. 14, 2022. (Isabel Infantes /AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: Truck Carrying Indian Soldiers Falls Into Gorge, Killing 16
entries.description: Closeup of an ambulance in India in a file photo. (Jose Hernandez/Shutterstock)

entries.title: Japan Approves New Policy to Maximize Nuclear Energy Use
entries.description: A general view of radiation contaminated water tanks and the damaged reactors at Fukushima Daiichi nuclear power plant In Okuma, Japan, on Feb. 25, 2016. (Christopher Furlong/Getty Images)

entries.title: Weather Warnings in Place Across Canada as Fierce Storms Move Across the Country
entries.description: A person makes their way through the Sandy Hill neighbourhood of Ottawa on Dec. 23, 2022. (The Canadian Press/Spencer Colby)

entries.title: Military Bases Had $260 Million in Damages From Afghan Evacuation
entries.description: Afghan refugee women register to be seen by a doctor inside the medical tent at Liberty Village on Joint Base McGuire-Dix- Lakehurst, N.J., on Dec, 2, 2021. (Barbara Davidson/Pool via AP)

entries.title: Japan Raises Military Spending to Record Levels as China Threat Looms
entries.description: Members of the Japan Ground Self-Defense Force stand in formation during the opening ceremony of Exercise Southern Jackaroo 21 at 1st Brigade Headquarters, at Robertson Barracks in the Northern Territory on June 15, 2021. (PTE Jacob Joseph/ADF)

entries.title: Charles ‘The Serpent’ Sobhraj Freed From Nepal Prison, Heads to France
entries.description: Police officers escort Charles Sobhraj, a French national known as 'the Serpent', accused of killing over 20 young Western backpackers across Asia, to the Department of Immigration after he was released from prison, following an order of Nepal's Supreme Court, in Kathmandu, Nepal, on Dec. 23, 2022. (Chandra Bahadur Ale/Reuters)

entries.title: US House Approves Ukraine Aid Including Arms After Zelenskyy Visit
entries.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy (R) and Polish President Andrzej Duda meet after Zelenskyy's visit to Washington, at Rzeszow-Jasionka Airport, Poland, on Dec. 22, 2022. (Jakub Szymczuk/KPRP/Handout via Reuters)

entries.title: Netflix Customers Could Face Criminal Charges For Sharing Their Password
entries.description: The Netflix menu is shown on a screen in Pittsburgh, on Monday, Oct. 17, 2022. (AP Photo/Gene J. Puskar)

entries.title: Over 1,000 Flights Cancelled by Westjet, Air Canada Due to Extreme Weather
entries.description: The tail of an Air Canada aircraft is seen behind a pile of snow at Vancouver International Airport in Richmond, B.C., on Dec. 21, 2022. (Darryl Dyck/The Canadian Press)

entries.title: Fight to Protect Western Australian River Still Unresolved
entries.description: Tourists are seen on a boat trip to see the Danggu Geikie Gorge National Park, on the Fitzroy River near Fitzroy Crossing in the Kimberley region of Western Australia, Oct. 15, 2022. ( AAP Image/Richard Wainwright)

entries.title: Australian Boxing Day Shoppers Ready to Smash Records
entries.description: People walk along Lonsdale Street during the Boxing Day sales in Melbourne, Australia, on Dec. 26, 2021. (Diego Fedele/Getty Images)

entries.title: Anti-Theft Number Plates to Be Rolled out in Australian State
entries.description: Victorian Premier Denis Napthine unveiled the new Victorian car number plates in Melbourne, Jun. 10, 2013. (AAP Image/Joe Castro)

entries.title: Massive Police-Led Iris Scan Collection in China Raises Concerns of State-Control and Repression: Study
entries.description:
Chinese paramilitary police (in green uniforms) secure an exit as Tibetans monks (C) walk out from a stadium at the end of at a local government sponsored festival in Yushu, in the northwestern Chinese province of Qinghai, on July 25, 2016.
(Nicolas Asfouri/AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: Christmas Day to Mark Start of Australian Heat Wave
entries.description: Lifeguards from North Bondi attend to a giant Christmas tree they erected at Bondi Beach in Sydney, Australia, on Dec. 25, 2010. (Don Arnold/Getty Images)
